creator: dead.cat@blueyonder.co.uk
text:
I have installed and use Apache HTTP Server 2.2.9 locally on my machine (OS = XP+SP3) primarily for practice script development - meaning PHP at this stage.

I also use Sunbelt Personal Firewall with Apache locked down lest my ISP objects to detecting this service on my machine.

In Sunbelt's 'Configuration | Network Security | Applications' section the blue Apache icon appears listed but unlike my other installed software there is no text description of what the software is, although filename and path can be made to display instead if required.  This is not a major issue but would you consider adding this feature to the Windows XP version?

This in no way impairs the working of the software.


JY

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
The 'httpd.exe' binary has the appropriate metadata, and we have no clue
what this software would be looking for in the binary or registry.
